sen.j: 坊城 俊完（ぼうじょう としまた、慶長14年11月27日 (旧暦)（1609年12月23日） - 寛文2年1月2日 (旧暦)（1662年2月20日））は、江戸時代の公家（公卿）。
sen.e: Toshimata BOJYO (Dec. 23, 1609 – Feb. 20, 1662) was a court noble in the Edo Period.
Toshimata BOJYO (Dec. 23, 1609 – Feb. 20, 1662) was a court noble in the Edo Period.
Toshimata BOJO (Dec. 23, 1609 – Feb. 20, 1662) was a court noble in the Edo Period.

sen.j: 堂上家（家格は、名家 (公家)、藤原北家高藤流勧修寺庶流）である、坊城家の11代当主。
sen.e: He was the 11th head of the Bojyo family (lineage can be traced to Kajuji branch family of the Takafuji group of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan) who were tosho-ke (the hereditary lineage of Court nobles occupying relatively high ranks).

He was the 11th head of the Bojyo family (lineage can be traced to Kajuji branch family of the Takafuji group of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan) who were tosho-ke (the hereditary lineage of Court nobles occupying relatively high ranks).

He was the 11th head of the Bojo family (lineage can be traced to Kajuji branch family of the Takafuji group of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan) who were tosho-ke (the hereditary lineage of Court nobles occupying relatively high ranks).
History
History
Career

sen.j: 参議・坊城俊昌の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of the Sangi, Toshimasa BOJO.
He was the second son of the Sangi, Toshimasa BOJO.
He was the second son of the Sangi, Toshimasa BOJO.

sen.j: 母は豊後守・松倉重政の娘。
sen.e: His mother was the daughter of Bungo no kami (governor of Bungo Province) Shigemasa MATSUKURA.
His mother was the daughter of Bungo no kami (governor of Bungo Province) Shigemasa MATSUKURA.
His mother was the daughter of Bungo no kami (governor of Bungo Province) Shigemasa MATSUKURA.

sen.j: 正室は木工頭・岩倉具尭（岩倉家の祖）の娘。
sen.e: His lawful wife was the daughter of Moku no kami (chief of Bureau of Carpentry) Tomotaka IWAKURA (founder of the Iwakura family).
His lawful wife was the daughter of Moku no kami (chief of Bureau of Carpentry) Tomotaka IWAKURA (founder of the Iwakura family).
His lawful wife was the daughter of Moku no kami (chief of Bureau of Carpentry) Tomotaka IWAKURA (founder of the Iwakura family).

sen.j: 継室は、大和守・織田尚長（柳本藩主）の娘。
sen.e: His second wife was the daughter of the Governor of Yamato Province, Naonaga ODA (head of Yanagimoto Domain).
His second wife was the daughter of the Governor of Yamato Province, Naonaga ODA (head of Yanagimoto Domain).
His second wife was the daughter of the Governor of Yamato Province, Naonaga ODA (head of Yanagimoto Domain).

sen.j: 実子に権大納言・坊城俊広など。
sen.e: Biological children include Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) Toshiro BOJO.
Biological children include Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) Toshiro BOJO.
Biological children include Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) Toshihiro BOJO.

sen.j: はじめ、権中納言・葉室頼宣の養子（葉室家を相続）となり、葉室頼豊と称する。
sen.e: He first became Gon chunagon Yorinobu HAMURO's foster child and was called Yoritoyo HAMURO.
He first became Gon chunagon Yorinobu HAMURO's foster child and was called Yoritoyo HAMURO.
He first became Gon chunagon Yorinobu HAMURO's foster child and was called Yoritoyo HAMURO.

sen.j: 元和 (日本)2年（1616年）、坊城家10代当主の坊城俊直（後の権大納言・勧修寺経広）が、右兵衛佐・勧修寺教豊の養子となり勧修寺家を相続した。
sen.e: In 1616, the 10th head of the Bojyo family, Toshinao Bojo(later Gon dainagon, Tsunehiro KAJUJI) became Uhyoe no suke (assistant captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards) Noritoyo KAJUJI's foster child and inherited the Kajuji family. Therefore Yoritoyo HAMURO returned to to his original family and was called Toshimata BOJO.

In 1616, the 10th head of the Bojyo family, Toshinao Bojo(later Gon dainagon, Tsunehiro KAJUJI) became Uhyoe no suke (assistant captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards) Noritoyo KAJUJI's foster child and inherited the Kajuji family. Therefore Yoritoyo HAMURO returned to to his original family and was called Toshimata BOJO.

In 1616, the 10th head of the Bojo family, Toshinao Bojo (later Gon dainagon, Tsunehiro KAJUJI) became Uhyoe no suke (assistant captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards) Noritoyo KAJUJI's foster child and inherited the Kajuji family.
sen.cmt: Bojyo→Bojo、一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: そこで、葉室頼豊が帰家し、坊城俊完と称した。
sen.e: Therefore Yoritoyo HAMURO returned to his original family and was called Toshimata BOJO.
sen.cmt: 重複するtoを削除。一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.e: He became Sangi on May 2, 1632.
He became Sangi on May 2, 1632.
He became Sangi on May 2, 1632.

sen.j: 極位極官は、正二位・権大納言。
sen.e: He eventually reached Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Gon dainagon.
He eventually reached Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Gon dainagon.
He eventually reached Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Gon dainagon.

sen.j: 明暦3年（1657年）8月20日、出家し常空と号す。
sen.e: On Aug. 20, 1657, he became a monk and was called Joku.
On Aug. 20, 1657, he became a monk and was called Joku.
On Aug. 20, 1657, he became a monk and was called Joku.
